thread.title: Report: Trump Has Put Two More Regimes In Middle East On Notice Over Threats To US
thread.title_full: Report: Trump Has Put Two More Regimes In Middle East On Notice Over Threats To US

author: Yochanan Visser
title: Report: Trump Has Put Two More Regimes In Middle East On Notice Over Threats To US
text:
Report: Trump Has Put Two More Regimes In Middle East On Notice Over Threats To US by Yochanan Visser February 24, 2017 at 8:20am Share on Facebook Share Tweet Email Email Print Advertisement - story continues below 
The Israeli news site Jerusalem Online, citing a four-page intelligence cable, revealed Thursday that Iran wasn’t the only entity in the Middle East that was put “on notice” by the Trump administration in February. 
The cable told a completely different story about a recent visit by new CIA director Mike Pompeo to the Palestinian Authority in Ramallah and the Jordanian capital, Amman. 
Israeli and Palestinian media had reported that Pompeo’s visit was about establishing a back channel with the Trump administration and said the meeting had been reassuring for the Palestinian leadership, as it was constructive and conducted in a positive atmosphere. Advertisement - story continues below Trump Promises Military Buildup To Send A Global Message 
Israeli journalist Shlomi Eldar who is well informed on what happens in the Palestinian Authority and Hamas wrote in his column for al-Monitor that “the Palestinians were feeling optimistic after a series of discussions that Majid Faraj, head of the Palestinian Security Services, had in Washington the second week in February and a meeting between Abbas and CIA Director Mike Pompeo Feb. 14 at Palestinian Authority (PA) headquarters in Ramallah.” 
However, according to JOL that is not what actually transpired during Pompeo’s visit to Ramallah. 
The intelligence cable that JOL obtained via an Arab intelligence official said Trump had put Jordan and the Palestinian Authority “on notice” over plans to launch a massive new Intifada because of the Administration’s plan to move the American embassy from Tel Aviv to Jerusalem. Advertisement - story continues below 
Trump reportedly conveyed a message to Palestinian leader Mahmoud Abbas and Jordanian King Abdullah that if they went through with their plan to launch a new Intifada “the gates of hell” would be opened for them. 
“A source associated with the Jordanian Opposition stated that both Abu Mazen and the Jordanian King know that the embassy move will bring about their demise,” JOL reported, using Mahmoud Abbas’ nickname. 
Pompeo reportedly told Abbas that if he didn’t stop plotting the new Intifada he could forget about the establishment of a Palestinian state in parts of the so-called West Bank (Judea and Samaria), while Abdullah received a warning that he could lose U.S. support for his regime, which is generally considered the custodian of the Muslim holy places in Jerusalem. 
Both Arab leaders were told that their threats to stir unrest in the Arab world over the embassy move were unacceptable and would backfire. Advertisement - story continues below
